learnings.title: OAuth State Validation Issue in Cloud Run Deployment

issue.description: OAuth state parameter validation fails in staging/production environments with error: "Invalid state parameter - authentication failed"

item.problem: Cookie domain mismatch in Cloud Run deployments
item.details: Auth service runs on: netra-auth-service-*.run.app Frontend runs on: netra-frontend-staging-*.run.app Cookies set on auth service domain are not sent back after OAuth redirect
Session cookies with SameSite=Lax won't persist across the OAuth flow when Google redirects back to the auth service

symptoms.symptom: OAuth callback fails with "Invalid state parameter" error
Session cookie missing in callback request
State validation consistently fails in staging/production
Works locally but fails in Cloud Run

solution.approach: Implement fallback mechanisms for state validation

step.action: Ensure OAuth credentials use correct environment variables
step.details: Cloud Run provides GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID and GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET from Secret Manager, not environment-specific variables

testing.test: Created comprehensive test suite in test_oauth_state_validation.py
Tests state generation, storage, retrieval, and validation
Tests concurrent OAuth flows and state expiration

practice.title: State Parameter Security
practice.description: Always validate OAuth state parameters to prevent CSRF attacks, but provide graceful fallbacks for cross-domain deployments

practice.title: Cookie Configuration
practice.description: Be aware of cookie domain restrictions in microservice architectures. Consider using shared domains or alternative session storage

practice.title: Environment-Specific Configuration
practice.description: Maintain flexibility in OAuth configuration to handle different deployment environments (local, staging, production)

monitoring.metric: Monitor state validation failures vs successes
Alert on high rates of "Invalid state parameter" errors

prevention.measure: Use a shared domain for all services (e.g., *.netrasystems.ai) to avoid cookie issues
Consider using URL parameters or JWT tokens for state management instead of cookies
Implement robust logging for OAuth flow debugging
